PageTitle: bestroute bit-error-detection (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)
FuncDef:
The bestroute bit-error-detection command enables bit-error-triggered rerouting.
The undo bestroute bit-error-detection command disables bit-error-triggered rerouting.
By default, bit-error-triggered rerouting is disabled.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In an H-VPN scenario, to rectify continuous packet loss on UPEs and NPEs, you can run the bestroute bit-error-detection command to enable bit-error-triggered rerouting on the UPEs. With this function enabled, each UPE can detect bit errors on a tunnel to an SPE and switches traffic to the secondary tunnel to prevent traffic loss. After the tunnel bit errors are rectified, the UPE switches back to the primary tunnel.
Configuration Impact
If a bit error event has occurred before you configure bit-error-triggered rerouting on the UPE, the UPE may select a path other to transmit traffic after you run the bestroutebit-error-detection command.
